newsitem.title: USA: Oracle shrs seen flat till FYQ3 - Goldman.
newsitem.headline: Oracle shrs seen flat till FYQ3 - Goldman.

text.p: Oracle Corp's stock is unlikely to gain from recent lows until the database software company reports its fiscal third-quarter results in March, Goldman, Sachs & Co analyst Rick Sherlund said Monday.

"We believe Oracle's stock is stuck in 'no man's land' until it reports for the February quarter," Sherlund wrote in a report released Monday. "It will likely take some encouraging news on European operations for the stock to perform and investor apprehensions may grow as the quarter progresses."
Oracle, based in Redwood Shores, California, blamed slow sales of database software in Europe for less-than-expected earnings in its fiscal second quarter, ended November.
